articles.headline: Egyptian Military Fires on Mexican Tourists During Picnic
articles.snippet: The attack in broad daylight by a helicopter raised new questions about the competence of security forces and the prevalence of the militants they were hunting.
articles.abstract: The attack in broad daylight by a helicopter raised new questions about the competence of security forces and the prevalence of the militants they were hunting.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — The convoy of four sport utility vehicles full of Mexican tourists was about three hours southwest of Cairo on a typical adventure trip through the White Desert, an otherworldly landscape of monumental chalk-rock formations. Around midday on Sunday, a diabetic passenger complained that she needed to eat.
articles.byline: By Merna Thomas and David D. Kirkpatrick

articles.headline: Democrats Lay Groundwork to Expand Use of ‘Super PACs’
articles.snippet: A request filed with the Federal Election Commission asks to employ tactics Republican presidential candidates have pioneered, and could force a ruling on their legality.
articles.abstract: A request filed with the Federal Election Commission asks to employ tactics Republican presidential candidates have pioneered, and could force a ruling on their legality.
articles.lead_paragraph: Democrats are laying the groundwork for an ambitious reorganization of their struggling network of “super PACs“ that would exploit the loopholes and legal gray areas that Republicans have already used to raise hundreds of millions of dollars for the 2016 campaign through such groups.

articles.headline: Vinyl LP Frenzy Brings Record-Pressing Machines Back to Life
articles.snippet: Old presses are being restored and put to work making vinyl records, still a niche product but much in demand from younger music enthusiasts.
articles.abstract: Old presses are being restored and put to work making vinyl records, still a niche product but much in demand from younger music enthusiasts.
articles.lead_paragraph: BORDENTOWN, N.J. — The machines at Independent Record Pressing whirred and hissed as they stamped out a test record. The business’s owners waited anxiously for Dave Miller, the plant manager, to inspect the still-warm slab of vinyl.

articles.headline: United Airlines Customer Dissatisfaction Festers, 5 Years After Merger
articles.snippet: Despite the 2010 merger of United Airlines and the well-regarded Continental Airlines, United has not won high ratings.
articles.abstract: Despite the 2010 merger of United Airlines and the well-regarded Continental Airlines, United has not won high ratings.
articles.lead_paragraph: The merger of Continental Airlines and United Airlines in 2010 was supposed to combine Continental’s reputation for solid customer service with the broader reach of United’s domestic and international network.
articles.byline: By Jad Mouawad and Martha C. White

articles.headline: Poised for Rate Increase, Investors Hope for Small Ripples
articles.snippet: While most experts don’t expect that an increase in interest rates will lead to 2008-style instability, tighter monetary policy could expose frailties in the financial system.
articles.abstract: While most experts don’t expect that an increase in interest rates will lead to 2008-style instability, tighter monetary policy could expose frailties in the financial system.
articles.lead_paragraph: The moment that Wall Street has long been dreading could happen this week.

articles.headline: Autoworkers Go to Fiat Chrysler for First Talks
articles.snippet: The United Automobile Workers is starting with Fiat Chrysler, the least profitable of the three automakers and the one with the most younger workers.
articles.abstract: The United Automobile Workers is starting with Fiat Chrysler, the least profitable of the three automakers and the one with the most younger workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Contract talks continued on Tuesday between the United Automobile Workers union and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, which was selected by the union to be the first among Detroit’s three carmakers to negotiate a new national labor agreement.

articles.headline: The Surprising Target of Jeb Bush’s Tax Plan: Private Equity
articles.snippet: In a departure from Republican orthodoxy, Jeb Bush has called for raising taxes on carried interest and eliminating companies’ ability to deduct the cost of interest payments.
articles.abstract: In a departure from Republican orthodoxy, Jeb Bush has called for raising taxes on carried interest and eliminating companies’ ability to deduct the cost of interest payments.
articles.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, Henry R. Kravis, the private equity investor, held a $100,000 a plate fund-raising dinner for Jeb Bush at his Park Avenue apartment in Manhattan. The guest list was a who’s who of private equity and real estate executives, including Jerry I. Speyer, the billionaire New York property owner.

articles.headline: Amid California Wildfires, Escapes and Choices
articles.snippet: Firefighters across the state are still battling to contain a dozen large wildfires that have killed at least one person, destroyed hundreds of homes and displaced 13,000 people.
articles.abstract: Firefighters across the state are still battling to contain a dozen large wildfires that have killed at least one person, destroyed hundreds of homes and displaced 13,000 people.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIDDLETOWN, Calif. — As they watched the sky go black and flames race toward their homes, the artists and campers, retirees and families living in this mountain town knew it was time to flee. Some, fearing that the drought-fueled fires raging across California would bring this moment to their door, had bags packed, ready to go. Others did not.

articles.headline: For Those Who Remain in Syria, Daily Life Is a Nightmare
articles.snippet: In cities like Douma, a suburb of Damascus, routine strikes have forced residents to flee and severely disrupted life for those who are unable to.
articles.abstract: In cities like Douma, a suburb of Damascus, routine strikes have forced residents to flee and severely disrupted life for those who are unable to.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Every morning, at the dawn call to prayer, women and children move silently from the Damascus suburb of Douma to the surrounding farm fields, seeking safety from the day’s bombardments by the Syrian government.
articles.byline: By Maher Samaan and Anne Barnard
